availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Boone Faver (Hopkins County, Ky, farmer and soldier (17th Ky Inf, 21st Ky Vet Inf, 25th Ky Inf))

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Father of John Faver. Married to Sarah Faver. Father of Virginia Faver. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Served in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from October 15, 1861. Served in the 25th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from January 1, 1862 to December 7, 1864. Transferred to 21st Kentucky Veteran Infantry (U.S.A.) on December 7, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 52B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Seminary, p. 148A.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 961-62.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0301, 0373.
